title: Rosetta Stone Application Install + Spanish (Spain) 1, 2, 3
description:
****** Thanks for downloading!!! You won&#039;t be disappointed!!! *****

Yes, these files will install the main Rosetta Stone application, crack the activation, 
and install Spanish (Spain) Language Packs 1, 2, and 3.

-Do you know how to work with .iso&#039;s?

-Do you know what a virtual drive is?

-Do you know how to mount and unmount?

If you answered NO to any of those questions, I&#039;ll assume you need to get some additional software.

Here is a link: <a href=" http://www.magiciso.com/tutorials/miso-magicdisc-overview.htm?=mdisc_hlp93" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.magiciso.com/tutorials/miso-magicdisc-overview.htm?=mdisc_hlp93</a>


Its freeware and safe; I&#039;ve used it for a long time.  You want to install MagicDisc, NOW.

Finished installing MagicDisc? You should see an icon for MagicDisc down by your clock.

Excellent!


***INSTALLING THE PROGRAM***


Right+click on the MagicDisc icon by your clock.
Go to the top of the menu and select Virtua CS/DVD-ROM
- You shold now see a drive letter and "No Media" (example: F:No Media)
Select, and then select MOUNT
Browse to the file: The Rosetta Stone Version 3 Application (PC).iso
This should auto run and install the Rosetta Stone program.
Once installed, follow the instructions again and select UNMOUNT to clear your virtual drive
(Its like ejecting the CD)

***CRACKING***

Open the file: Rosetta_Stone_Version_3_crack.zip
Copy: LicencingDLL.dll

Open your Rosetta Stone Directory
(Example: C:Program FilesRosetta StoneRosetta Stone V3)
If you see LicencingDLL.dll already in the folder, you are in teh CORRECT place.
Now copy the file, say YES when it says it Already Exists and wants to replace)
(You can drag and drop too if you are uncomfortable with copying)

As long as it asks If you want to replace and you say YES, you shold be finished.


***RUN ROSETTA STONE***
When you start the program, you will get a "Minor Error"; its going to happen ALL THE TIME. 
Hey, what did you expect?  It will also error when you close the program; usually an instruction error.

***ADD LANGUAGE PACK***
So I&#039;ve included Spanish (Spain) 1, 2, & 3
Lets install Spanish 1

Just as you mounted the iso to install, you need to mount the language iso.
Follow the mounting instructions above. (as you should have unmounted already)
Mount file: Spain 1 .iso

Go back to Rosetta Stone program (open again if you closed it)
You should easily see the link to add a language.
Just follow the steps and it will read the language pack on your virtual drive.
Install and enjoy!!!

You should not get any errors or activation messages anymore.

Thanks
OneBadUnit
